overview:
Felix is CEO of amiando, Europe’s leading online service for on-demand event organization and event ticketing. He founded his first venture, an international website network, during his schooldays. As a student he co-founded several organizations and spent more than two years in Silicon Valley, including working at the BMW Technology Office Palo Alto and projects in conjunction with Google and Stanford University. He is co-author of multiple patents, including the recently released Google Maps “Send to Car” functionality. In late 2006 he co-founded amiando and as the company’s CEO, he has been in charge of its product, financing and communication.

Felix is a Technology Pioneer 2010 by the World Economic Forum, a member of Entrepreneurs Organization and a frequent speaker about internet innovation. He studied electrical engineering at Technical University Munich and the ETH Zurich. Felix is an instrument-rated commercial US pilot and loves to fly when he’s not obsessing over amiando’s business.
